meanings.definition: In a state of nervous indecision or agitation.
meanings.sent1: She felt dithery about choosing a movie to watch.
meanings.sent2: The dithery squirrel couldn't decide which acorn to pick.
meanings.sent3: The dithery cat kept pacing back and forth in front of its empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: His dithery behavior reminded me of a leaf blowing aimlessly in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The dithery clouds seemed unsure whether to bring rain or sunshine.

meanings.definition: To act in a nervous or indecisive manner.
meanings.sent1: She tends to dither when choosing what to wear.
meanings.sent2: The students dithered before answering the difficult question.
meanings.sent3: The chef dithered over which spices to add to the soup.
meanings.sent4: The politician dithered on whether to support the new policy.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly dithered in the air before landing on the flower.
